oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pocket Testament of Pvt. Joel Crosby, Co. B, 17th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 1861 pocket testament was presented to Joel S. Crosby by William Crist, September 16, 1862. Crosby was from LaGrange (Ind." and joined Co. B, 17th Ind. Inf. Regt., USA. He was discharged for disability on November 14, 1862. Crosby reenlisted; in Co. A, 1st Ind. Arty. Regt., USA (also known as the 21st Ind. Arty. Regt., USA). This unit later became a heavy artillery regiment. Crosby settled in Spring City, Rhea County (Tenn.) after the war.
